string.text:
The Stechkin APS is a Russian selective fire machine pistol, bearing the name of its designer Igor Stechkin. The Stechkin automatic pistol was originally chambered for 7.62x25mm Tokarev but was changed to the 9x18mm calibre used in the new Makarov pistol, as it became clear that this cartridge was set to become the new service ammunition for handguns in the Soviet Army. In 1951, both the Makarov and Stechkin were introduced into the Soviet military arsenal, replacing the ageing TT-33.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using Tactical Kit.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: None

The Stechkin APS is a Russian selective fire machine pistol, bearing the name of its designer Igor Stechkin. The Stechkin automatic pistol was originally chambered for 7.62x25mm Tokarev but was changed to the 9x18mm calibre used in the new Makarov pistol, as it became clear that this cartridge was set to become the new service ammunition for handguns in the Soviet Army. In 1951, both the Makarov and Stechkin were introduced into the Soviet military arsenal, replacing the ageing TT-33.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Threaded barrel for using with 9mm sound suppressor, Tritium sights and ergonomic pistol grip rubber.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: 9mm

%c[ui_gray_1]The kit includes: Threaded barrel for using with APB sound suppressor, Tritium sights and ergonomic pistol grip rubber. This upgrade is irreversible.\n %c[ui_gray_2]COMPATIBILITY:\n %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] APS pistol
